Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: LyndaBernhardt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WestCord Art Hotel 3* although it was more like a 4*. The front line receptionist spoke English. Hotel staff very attentive and helpful. Check in was fast and hassle free. We were advised where to catch the bus from, bus stop just outside the hotel. And what number bus to catch back to out hotel, bus no 48/42. We could purchase our bus tickets directly from the hotel. It is a short bus ride into Centraal Station, 5min. Our room was clean and spacious. Rooms cleaned, towels, soaps and lotions refreshed daily. Beds were extremely comfortable, and after having had a back operation were a welcoming place to come to after a long day of sight seeing. Breakfast was excellent! I will most definately stay at the WestCord Art Hotel again when I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Ayisha A
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went on a 3 day break to Amsterdam. The hotel is a way away from the main city centre. We had looked that up before hand and were not phased by it. However there is a bus stop just outside and two buses 22 (and 47 if I remember correctly) that take you into the city. They ran till late and frequently. A taxi cost about 15 Euros and between 18-20 for a 7 seater which was still reasonable specially since we were splitting it between the 5 of us. The hotel was clean, the staff were nice and friendly. It was bit of an issue getting the safe to work, which we figured out eventually. The staff did try to help and couldn't make it work at first but did offer to have a new one brought in if I wanted them to. The heating was a little low for my liking and they brought me two additional heaters very promptly on request so I could heat up the room to my liking. One day when I didn't want the cleaners in my room, I left the do not disturb sign on the door and no one entered my room in my absence and I was left a note explaining why the room hadn't been cleaned.(Which is exactly what I expected and wanted) We were out late on both the nights and had no problems getting in at 2:00 am and 5:00 am respectively. We received a friendly greeting for the lady at receptions both days We wanted some cutlery for some take away we had brought in and the staff were very helpful and accommodating with that too. We did have to pay a one off tax of around 8 Euros per room for the stay, which was not much but was a surprise. My room was on the 5th floor and due to the layout I had to take one lift to the 3rd floor and then walk across and take another to the 5th which was not that difficult also just unexpected. And lastly the bathroom door and walls are transparent on one side and has frosted glass on the other side, which is fine for a couple but we did feel oddly to start with when we went with friends. However once we got there we realised you wouldn't actually see into the shower unless you meant to do so. However, this may still be a bit odd if you are not a couple. All in all a good stay! The hotel was great!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Claire T
Reviews.Content: My finance and I stayed at the WestCord Art Hotel over Easter and from the moment we arrived I was impressed by the level of service. The reception staff were really friendly and had lots of advice for catching buses and getting around Amsterdam. The sold bus passes as well, at a discount rate. Our room was spotless, and lovely and quiet in the evenings. The hotel itself is a 10 minute bus ride from Amsterdam Central Train Station, however the buses come every 10 minutes and we never had to wait. Overall very convenient, and I would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “cool but so far from center”
Reviews.Author: Qant
Reviews.Content: all fine, free wifi, electric teapot with cafe o te was nice. bad old tv to far from center

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, poor soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: beck_hoose
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at the hotel, during a weekend break in Amsterdam. We booked the hotel because of its good reviews, price and location to Amsterdam city. The location of the hotel is excellent. A number 22 or 48 bus outside the hotel takes you into the Central station in 10 Minutes. Buses are every 15 minutes. We arrived by car, so it was quite simple to find the hotel off the A10 ring road. The hotel charged 22 Euros for 24 Hour parking. The parking lot is located beneath the hotel, and quite tricky getting in and out. The Receptionists were very helpful and efficient. We booked in early (11 o'clock), which was fine by the hotel, but they advised they couldn't alocate us a room until everybody had checked out and the rooms cleaned. This was no problem, as it let us into the city to explore. We returned to the hotel late at night and got allocated our room keys, which was no problem. We didn't use the restaurant, but we did use the bar, again was fine. The rooms are spotless and functional, with comfy beds. Only issue was the single beds pushed together to make a double bed. The soundproofing of the rooms was not very good. We were on the 1st floor and were woken in the early morning by the staff moving tables in the restaurant below, preparing for breakfast. Our room was also next to a Fire Door, making a banging sound reverberate through the rooms whenever anyone went through the door. A party of approx 4 youths were staying at the end of our corridor constantly going through the fire door and shouting. I called the night porter who did come up to reprimand the youths (Brits I'm sad to report), which did help for a while before the noise started back up again. Overall, the hotel is nice, clean, functional, easy accessible, but If I were to stay there again, I would ask for a room on the upper floors, at the end of a corridor. We didn't take the breakfast option (17 Euros each), deciding to take our breakfast in an Amsterdam cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Fun In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Geoff F
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time I've stayed at the Art Hotel. The bar and dining room is good, but the breakfasts are even better, if you like croisants, that is. Why is is that hotels have to serve processed cereals? What's wrong with whole-grains?? The rooms are fine; very comforable. Good bathrooms; comfortable beds; free wi-fi. I even hired to bike to ride to a business meeting. Very Dutch.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: Clint L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room was excellent for the price, 2 bedrooms, both with double bed. About 10 minutes from the city centre. 2 buses to the city centre. Bus stops right outside the hotel. Bus fare is 2.70 Eur, however you can purchase an extended bus ticket at the ticket office just in front of the central train and bus station. Taxi will cost you about 15 Eur. Be aware, the bath and shower had glass walls (not the toilet), so if this is a problem check with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: MiiiiRa
Reviews.Content: Safe and comfterable. Very nice place to stay :-) just a bit outside the centrum if you wish to sleep with no worries and away from the craziness :-)

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT, My boyfriend and I had a great time”
Reviews.Author: nancy1987
Reviews.Content: First time in Amsterdam, didnt know where to book, however looked this hotel reviews was very good. When we get to Amsterdam, the hotel was so easy to find, just right next to the bus station, Paid 70 pounds upgrade from the 3stars to 4stars. have one bath one shower room, it was beautiful, very big room. and nice sofa by the window. and the hotel stuff are very lovely. very easy to get to central. But never eating in the hotel restaurant, its very expensive. Me and my boyfriend had a wonderful time, i would book it again! and the bed is so big and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Speechless! Amazing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Spatziano747
Reviews.Content: In short, this hotel is awesome! I searched high and low for the ideal hotel for a trip to Amsterdam. I noticed the price was affordable so I opted to stay here. A.) The hotel is not in the city center, but don't let that scare you. You can take bus 22 or 48 for 2.60 EUR, which drops you off at Central Station (about a 10-15 minute drive). The trip back is just as easy from Central Station. Cabs will run you 14 EUR or more, so this is a much more affordable option. B.) The hotel is beautiful, artsy, and CLEAN! The rooms are larger than your average European hotel room and quite modern. Our room was really nice with a LARGE bathroom. The beds were comfortable and the facility itself was quiet....no loud street noise or party's. C.) The staff was accommodating in every way. From check-in to check-out, they were friendly, knowledge and never unwilling to help answer questions. Special thanks to Astrid for answering a slew of our questions...lots of patience. Stellar agent. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. Feel free to reach out of if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean hotel..but beware if needing twin room”
Reviews.Author: Floozle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel for a short break in Amsterdam. We were aware that the location was slightly out of the centre but that was not a problem. Overall the hotel was very clean, modern, the staff were helpful and friendly and the restaurant food was nice. I am writing this review as a warning to anyone booking a twin room. In this hotel a twin bed is a double frame with 2 single mattresses placed side by side - essentially a double bed with single duvet covers! You are very close to each other - we ended up making a 'pillow barricade' The other issue is the glass cubicle bathroom - there is some frosting on one side but the other is clear. Due to room size and large wall mirrors you can easily see each other in bath or shower. The toilet is separate but next to bed and certainly not soundproof! There is no handbasin in in the toilet either which felt unhygienic.. We ended up often using main hotel toilets (which were spotlessly clean) My friend and I coped with what we christened the 'loveshack' with amusement but it wasn't ideal for platonic friends.

Reviews.Title: “Already booked next stay!”
Reviews.Author: kdali7
Reviews.Content: The Art 3 and 4 are the same hotel, and I stayed in the 4 star side. Very clean and modern, with comfortable beds. Enough room for two, just be aware of the clear shower door. I thought that the cafe prices were high until about day 3, then I noticed it was fair (20 euro breakfast buffet/15euro evening entrees). Room service is not available late, and the terrace is so nice you wouldn't want to order in anyway. The service is unreal, they will gladly help you with anything you need! Had no problems using the free wifi, except I got hacked, but that's not their fault. I can't wait to go back! Public transportation was easy after a bit, take the 48 during the day, the 348 at night. It's a 15min ride to central station, and totally worth not having to share a bathroom in a gross hostel. There was a strike when we arrived, so we took the shared ride shuttle, which I will not do again because it's an extra 45min for a little less than a taxi. I used the IAmsterdam card as well and thought it was worth it. If you want to exchange currency at 0%, there's an office to the left of the Victoria (across from central station).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adrian P
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience from start to finish. Rooms excellent and new with very comfortable beds. The receptionists were very helpful and kind. The hotel is 5-10mins away from the centre by bus 22 & 48. The buses are always on time and pass by every 10 mins. Closest bus stop is Hempoint. Hotel highly recommended from a frequent traveller. Will surely book this hotel if I ever visit Amsterdam again. Stayed for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way.”
Reviews.Author: pjmoorhouse
Reviews.Content: The Westcord was a superb end to a long day of travelling. Polite, swift check in and a wonderful sumptuous room with a huge bed and fantastic glass walled bathroom. The food served in the bar was also first rate. The only down side is the hotel is train ride from the delights of Amsterdam city centre but if it's somewhere to relax in comfort you're after this hotel ticks all the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “as always a good stay especially when by car”
Reviews.Author: cloggie1954
Reviews.Content: City centre easy to get to through public transport; busstop at 200 meter Good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Art Amsterdam Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Art Hotel Amsterdam a few times but it is worth staying in the 4 star part intead of the 3 star part as my experience of the 3 star was room (3)10 was very small. They have smoking rooms or not the best rooms in my opinion are *33, 233 is smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but requires a 10 min. bus trip to city center”
Reviews.Author: MikeWithBike
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, and clean rooms. And the price is good. The location is approx 10 min away by bus from the city center. No problem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice but too far out of town”
Reviews.Author: midgemc
Reviews.Content: I mistakenly booked the Westcard Art Hotel,instead of Westcord Fashion Hotel.(Fashion Has a swimming pool). I knew it was going to be out of town but because of the pool,I felt it would be worth it. Art hotel didnt have an open pool. The hotel itself was lovely. Breakfast was great. The bus was very reliable and frequent, and stopped right outside the door...but for us it was just too far out of town. ( 10 mins on the bus) We did a lot of sightseeing and at times we just wanted to go back to the hotel for a break but had to give it serious thought every time. At night, we just went back to the hotel and didnt bother going out again whereas if we had been in the centre we may have wondered out around again in the night..Tha's the big negative about the hotel. The positive is that travel tickets etc are available from reception. Everyone spoke english(we dont speak Dutch!). We found it very easy to get around Amsterdam because the public transport is greatand cheap.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: daggamonster
Reviews.Content: let me start this review by saying that i have almost 20 years experience in the service industry. my wife and I stayed at this hotel in june of this year (2011) for 3 nights. we took the upgrade from the 3 star, which cost 20euro's a night and was well worth it in my opinion. i have to say that from the moment of booking the service was immpecable. i contacted the hotel about, among other things, the deposit and was pleasantly surprised by both the speed and the friendly professionalism of the reply(which came personally from the manager). the facilities were excellent, the room clean, comfortable and well presented. the staff i found to be friendly and helpfull. the hotel itself, while situated outside of town, is right on a bus route(and if you know about amsterdam's public transport you know that means it is easily accesible at all hours of the day or night) personally i found the location ideal as it was nice and quiet, making for well rested nights. all in all, it was great value for my money, and as i stated in my title i would definitely stay again, in fact i look forward to it. thank you to all the staff their for our wonderfull stay, with especial thanks to the general manager mr. Tam

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: SchalkL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated with great facilities like free WIFI, bicycle rentals and airport transportation. Very modern hotel with modern clean rooms. Service was very efficient. Weâ€™ll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: shazlizdav
Reviews.Content: The Westcord Art is a bright, vibrant looking hotel that doesn't disappoint. The rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious enough to spread out if you need to. It's a little outside the city centre so lovely and quiet with easy access as the bus stops right outside.The staff are wonderful, nothing is too much, all questions answered courteously with a smile. The restaurant staff are AMAZING and the food HEAVENLY according to my teenagers "The Best Burgers in the World" for myself and husband the wine list was fantastic, some of the best wine we've ever tasted . Must mention Christo and Mukhije, from the restaurant - THE most friendly, attentive and staff members I have ever come across, Thanks for the wonderful food and wine guys!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: LindaMcDowall
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Staff very friendly, nothing a bother to them. Nice room, very clean and also nice clean bathroom with clean towels each day. Very quiet at night also. Breakfast was excellent in a nice bright dining room. Very good value for money we thought. Bus stops right outside to Amsterdam Central, 22 & 48 bus. It took no longer than 5/7 minutes. Travel from airport could not have been easier. We had read a couple of previous reviews and followed the one taking train to Sloterdijk station and then 48 bus to Hempoint which is right outside hotel. It took no more than 20 minutes all in, much quicker than going right into Amsterdam central, fantastic. Would most certainly recommend this hotel and if I am ever in Amsterdam again I will certainly stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dansken118
Reviews.Content: Perfect plate if u like walking thrugh cozy joordan district, wonderful walking route

Reviews.Title: “Tres bon/Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MmeH52
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Amsterdam for the marathon (Oct 2011) and stayed at the WestCord Art Hotel 4-stars with my friend and her elderly mother. To say we had an amazing time is an understatement. The staff are FANTASTIC and really came to my aid when I needed help with a bad situation (external situation to the hotel). The were helpful, went above and beyond their job descriptions and helped me and my travel companions feel safe, secure and cared for. The food was excellent in the restaurant and the rooms were impeccable. After the race, the bath, the dinner and the sleep in the hotel bed was all perfect. I would stay at the WestCord Art hotel again without a doubt. It was a close bus ride to Centraal Station and we never felt too far from the centre of activity. I recommend this hotel if you want a quieter night sleep than downtown/central offers. We had an excellent time!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Texmex69
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Art Hotel 4 Star a few days ago. We had booked a large design room, I had emailed earlier to request a room with a view as this was a birthday treat present!! I had also requested an early check in as our flight arrived very early from the UK. We arrived in Amsterdam and caught the train to Central Station. As advised on here, we caught the 48 bus which is located near the canal excursions right outside the station. The stop for the hotel is called Hempoint. You can catch the 22 but stay on the bus till its stops outside the hotel which is the terminus. The hotel staff were obliging and helpful. We were asked to wait a few minutes to check our room was ready. To our delight we had been upgraded to a SUITE. We also had glasses of bubbly and a very lovely dessert. This was a wonderful surprise and totally unexpected!! Thank you to Mr Tam and his staff and this really made our stay in Amsterdam extra special. We had a lovely dinner the first night in the Gallery restuarant again staff were friendly and helpful. We packed lots into the three day we were there. A few tips: buy and a travel card from reception we bought a 72 hours pass which cost 15 euros which gave us unlimted access on buses trams and metro. We also bought a 24hr pass for the Canal Bus which was excellent value as you can see so much more of Amsterdam via the canals. A short but excellent trip made more special by our stay at the Art Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Suprising gem on the outskirts on the city.”
Reviews.Author: Asau
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, trendy, friendly experience. Will be back in Jan! Many thanks

Reviews.Title: “Inadvertent Stay”
Reviews.Author: GavRace
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the trip here. Not a big one for long reviews so I'll make it short and sweet. Room was excellent, as was the company (R&O). Wished I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claire S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westcord Art Hotel October 2nd-October 6th and we loved it! Beautiful modern hotel, lovely looking restaurant (but very expensive so didnt eat there). Large clean room and bathroom, cleaner came every day whilst we were out and tidied the room, changed bed sheets ect. Friendly reception staff. We forgot a plug adaptor so they lent us one. They will also unlock the mini-fridges in the rooms if you want to put some of your own food in (useful for milk ect. for breafast as hotel breakfast price expensive). Hotel has bus stops right outside and the bus 48 runs every 15 minutes throughout the day from early to late. Cost us 2.60 to get to central station but we purchased a 72hour bus ticket for 17euros which enables you to use any bus, tram or metro in amsterdam which is brilliant! Large pool outside but as it was october we didnt venture into it! There is a BP garage just round the corner but it was under renovation when we went so we took a short bus ride to a nearby supermarket a few minutes down the road to get food and snacks. All in all a brilliant stay, we would definately stay again, and definately reccommend it to others! Thanks Westcord Art Hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Attractive business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilyAroundTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. The lobby certainly lives up to the hotel's name, as do other common areas of the hotel - there is a large amount of contemporary art throughout. The rooms were clean and well-appointed and the TV picks up BBC 1. I didn't check out the minibar or the fitness centre (hence a 'no star' rating). Overall, this is well-located, with a reasonable bar. I didn't eat an evening meal at the hotel, but the breakfast selection was good. Worth its four stars.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: amsoutter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit off the wall with some crazy art and room design. However it really works. Ignore the cow sculptures at the front of the hotel, this does not define them. Cleanliness here is the very best as a moany traveller when it comes ot clean rooms I could not fault the cleaning. Staff are freindly helpful and keen to please. Superb attitude from reception, to restaraunt. Location is very close to town centry with a bus stop 50 feet from the hotel travel to and from town is easy. We also walked in a few times around 30 mins taking it easy. I have been staying in Amsterdam now for around 6 weeks and will be there a lot this year. This is the only hotel I will stay in. The hotel is part 3 star and part 4 star but it works well. Price is also good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the short trips in and out of town”
Reviews.Author: DebbyMars
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Art. The bus ride in and out of central Amsterdam was no problem at all and being just outside the centre made the Art Hotel a peaceful haven from the bustle of the city. The room was spacious and clean, the bed comfortable and the staff pleasant and helpful. Would definitely stay there again and would recommend the hotel warmly to friends and family. The only down side was the ridiculously expensive food, especially the breakfasts, extortionate at â‚¬17!!! I popped into Amsterdam for mine. The one evening meal I did eat there was pleasant and served by very nice staff, but very expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Back a second time and no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: SLDay
Reviews.Content: We went here a couple of years ago and, having had no bad experiences, booked it again for our weekend away in August. The only downside was that we did not get a smoking room as requested, however we did book the night before on a bank holiday weekend so this was understandable! The hotel is not far from the city centre, there is a bus stop right outside and you can get good deals on public transport (about E12 per person for 48 hours, unlimited use of public transport). We chose to get the train from the airport instead of a transfer to save some cash, so picked the travel card up and went for a wander round before getting to the hotel. There is a petrol station with a small shop a couple of minutes walk away, and a supermarket and cashpoint a few more minutes down the road from that. The hotel looks very nice throughout, as you would expect from an 'art' hotel! The cows outside make it easy to spot while on the bus. We got one of the larger rooms and it was more than big enough for the two of us, and very nicely laid out and decorated. The minibar was locked but a quick phone call and someone came to empty it so we could put our own stuff in there. Didn't eat in the restaurant or drink in the bar, but it all looked very nice. We ordered the breakfast to our room one morning - E20 for a continental breakfast is extortionate in my opinion but I guess you pay for convenience. We ordered as much as we could though and it saw us through as a packed lunch as well, so that made it a bit more economical! Only cock-up was that the breakfast order on the door wasn't collected and when I went down to reception it was questioned whether I had left it out in time which was a bit annoying. However once assured they arranged for the order to be filled and extended our check-out time by an hour to make up for the delay they caused us. This hotel is a good base for exploring Amsterdam - close enough to the city to be connected to everything but far enough away for some peace and quiet at night!

Reviews.Title: “Best Amsterdam Hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: aart1961
Reviews.Content: The WestCord Art 4 star Hotel is the place to stay in Amsterdam. Very friendly and helpfull staff. Restaurant and Bar the Art Brasserie has an outside terrace. You should meet Christo and Esther....

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HIDDEN GEM”
Reviews.Author: kko_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in WestCord Art 4* for 2 nights, and we absolutely loved it!! I was kind of lost to find the hotel from the central station, but I managed to be there :) I booked a double but we had 2 singles pushed together, although, it was ok as the beds were so comfortable and large. Room was very clean and well equipt, there was everything we needed. I liked seperated tolilet and bathroom, also shower and bath. It didn't have great outside view, it was train maintenance area, but very nicely designed room with enough space and very quiet. I was going to use the pool, but it was raining so that I couldn't use. I'll definitely come back and use the pool next time. The last, every staff were very helpful and giving prompt service for all the requests. Thank you all, we had a lovely time with you!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ramona96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and at the WestCord Fashion Hotel Hotel. The room was very clean, nicely designed and very comfortable. The hotel is a bit out of the way from other attractions but there's a bus stop outside that brings you into the centre in about 10 minutes. The bus is fairly regular, about every 15 minutes or so at off peak times. The whole hotel is decorated with lots of paintings from a Dutch painter called Brood, a nice idea even if it's not exactly my taste of art. As with the Fashion Hotel, there is a problem with service. When I booked the rooms on the hotel website, I booked tickets to the Van Gogh museum for the following day. When I asked at reception could I collect the tickets, I was told they were sold out for that day. A couple of hours later I managed to easily get tickets for that same day at another shop in town that were valid all year! This is obviously a question of training - I looked at the Van Gogh website and you can print out tickets at any time, there isn't a restriction according to date as there is with the Anne Frank Huis. The girl at reception told me that no-one asks to book those tickets and if I waited for her manager to get there, he could have a look. I don't blame her for her lack of knowledge, it's the responsibility of management to ensure that all those on the desk are very familiar with all that the hotel offers - or why bother, it just makes the hotel look unprofessional? At checkout, the bill for those tickets was still on my account - they were taken off when I explained I never got them! The day that I went to collect my tickets, I waited 15 minutes to be served while a Dutch lady jumped the queue and took the time of two people on desk. This isn't acceptable customer service. The staff seem very young to me and not that bothered about their jobs. If there are consistently lines at front desk, more staff should be employed, especially at peak times. There should be more of a system in place - an area with maps of the city, bus, parking information. As I had booked tickets - these should have been given to me at check in/ sent to the room automatically, rather than me looking for them. I have worked myself in customer service and efficiently has a lot has to do with staff training and knowledge of product and an efficient system in place that allows them to do their job well. AND motivation from management! I have since looked at other reviews of the WestCord Fashion and Art Hotels and almost every review mentions the poor service at both hotels. An exception was the staff in the bar/bistro. I got coffee there every morning, the staff there were very friendly and efficient and should be complimented for their excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Colettedon
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay at the WestCord Art Hotel (5-7 August 2011). Very comfortable room, with friendly, helpful staff. Loved the big, deep bath and free Wifi. The hotel is a little outside the city centre, so we hired bicycles at Central Station for the duration of the stay, which made getting in and out of the city centre easy and enjoyable. The hotel appears to hire bicycles, although we didn't know this until we had already hired them from elsewhere, so this might be worth publicising more widely. Will definitely stay again when the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we made our visit and enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: retired1103
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room wasn't available but this was mainly because we arrived at a very early hour of the day- they were very helpful and stored our belongings for us while we went out and explored the city. When we returned in the afternoon we were given the key to our room - there was some mix up with the room from what we thought we were going to be given. We were very tired from being up so many hours due to us traveling from Ohio USA.. but we talked to the General Manager Benjamin Tam and he was very helpful through the whole situation. He made every effort to make us comfortable and we were set up with one of their extra large rooms overlooking the pool. We were staying there for over 2 weeks and the extra space made it even more pleasant. The Hotel is outside the inner City but some times that can be a good thing.. it was only 10 minutes by bus and the buses ran every 10 minutes or so - the only thing that I was totally disappointed in was the Breakfast served at the Hotel - don't waste your time or money. I want to take this time to Thank Mr. Benjamin Tam for making our stay a very pleasant experience. Best regards, Sandi Hooks

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient stay”
Reviews.Author: oxjohnnysangelxo
Reviews.Content: Pros: free wifi Convenient to public transport(Bus #48 stops right in front of hotel) Quiet Small fridge/mini bar(if you call reception they can unlock the fridge so you can remove their items and use the fridge for your own things) Public swmming pool in back Supermarket close by - walk down the street(away from gas station). Decor - local artists' work hang in lobby Free espressos/tea in the 4 star hotel lobby Individual Air conditioning Cons: No free breakfast( you can pay 15 euros but it isnt worth the amount - food is on par with free hostel breakfasts) Reception lacked information for simple recommendations(ie: local restaurants and supermarket) Rooms a bit smaller

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the outskirts”
Reviews.Author: ChristianPahl
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms with minibar. Very clean, good breakfast, nice bar. Bus stop (48 Hempoint) in front of the hotel. About 2km from city centre, great choice

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJMcVeigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 3 years ago when it was run by another hotel group and it was faultless. Upon my return we were off to a disappointing start when upon my 18:00 arrival I was told my rooms (3 of them) weren't ready. Check in is from 14:00 so I wasn't happy with this. Me and my travelling party went and got a drink at the bar outside an waited around 1 hour to 90 minutes for our rooms. By this time it was about 19:00. The hotel is a 15-20 minute walk to central station. 5 minutes on a bicycle, in a cab or on the local bus which runs every 10-15 minutes. Cabs will charge â‚¬15 to take you into town (about 1.5 miles) and on an evening expect to pay â‚¬15 to return or â‚¬5 per head if more than 3 are getting on a cab. The hotel is cleen with good facilities that you would expect from a 4 or 4*+ hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel a bus ride away from city center”
Reviews.Author: wildbirdseed
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westcord 4 star on our return to Amsterdam. It provided the convenience of a modern hotel outside of the city center. Take Bus 48 from Central Station, 10 min ride. Do not stay here if you want to see Amsterdam in a walk, it is too far away. Peaceful, large modern rooms with restaurant downstairs. Breakfast available for crazy price. Slept like babies in our king bed. Great for certain situations like business, not really the best location for site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: naveenprabhakaran Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: everything was good except for the bed...I booked a double bedroom and the room had a twin bed. when asked in the reception they confirmed they haven't got any double bed. suprized there is no double bed in a 4* hotel!!! on a positive note the morning breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “ruined”
Reviews.Author: wazza22
Reviews.Content: this was my 4th time in amsterdam usually staying in nh city centre decided to change this time.the hotel is not within walking distance to train station and at 15euros for a taxi everytime was non feasible,the hotel room i got was 224 it was horrendous like being in a brothel tacky.room service well for soup and apple pie Â£18 nice.to be fair thought for being an art hotel a could have done better paintings.so never waste a leisurely weekend in an industrial estate unless of course u enjoy that scenairo

Reviews.Title: “Nice decor, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: mollymaguire37
Reviews.Content: A little outside the old city (10 minutes by #48 bus from Centraal Station), this hotel offers crisp, artsy decor and room design, excellent cleanliness and condition, and helpful staff. The in-house bar/cafe offers good "pub grub"; the breakfasts are good but overpriced. It seems to appeal more to business than tourist travellers. Overall, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Trp_Adv_name
Reviews.Content: It's a little way out of town (about 10 mins on the 48 bus), which got annoying after 5 nights, but really, it's perfect for a weekend away! Be warned... buying the travel cards when you arrive at central station isn't as easy as you'd think (if only every city had something as easy to buy as Oyster cards for tourists)... This was an awful way to arrive in Amsterdam, so if this next lot of info helps one person I'll be a bit happier... the public transport tickets are on a time basis (from 1hr to 5 days) and work on buses and trams (tap in and out like Oyster cards)... if you arrive after 6pm the ticket office (which is outside central station) is shut... before 7pm you can get them (up to 4days long) in the crazy iAmsterdam (pretending to be a normal tourist info office) shop nextdoor... don't get a ticket and stand in line for a year... go straight to the little shop bit, where all the tacky postcards and salt n pepper shakers are and you can buy the transport ticket from the cash desk there. If it's after 7pm then you're kind of out of options... either jump on a tram and get a pass from the ticket booth in the middle (so weird they put a person in a booth on every tram instead of static booths)... or buy single (1hr) tickets from the bus driver and try again for the ticket shop the next day (not as cheap but A LOT less stressful!) We didn't buy the iAmsterdam card, because we didn't want 99% of the museums on it, and the transport card on its own is waaaaay cheaper! (fyi you can get tickets for the van gogh museum from the diamond museum down the road, queue is about 60 mins quicker that way!) OK now for the hotel... we booked into this, the 4* new addition... and it was pretty awesome, friendly and helpful staff, lots of tourist guides/ maps/ discount vouchers. Rooms are big, and very modern. Yes the bathroom walls are made of glass... but toilet is in a separate room... walk in shower as well as bath... some modesty screening on the glass walls... so it's not quite as odd as you first think! The 'twin' rooms are the same as the doubles... the beds aren't actually separate, but they're HUGE and the reception staff are very helpful and will provide a second duvet if you ask them. The pool was huge, sadly it wasn't the weather for it while we were there, it's a public pool, but free if you're staying in the hotel. If you're travelling without a laptop, there are a couple of PCs in the lobby for public use, which are well used, but you can usually get on one within 5mins. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel... clean, comfortable, modern, good price (compared with the rest of Amsterdam!)

Reviews.Title: “Our best hotel experience in Amsterdam yet”
Reviews.Author: Kezzer467
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam a number of times over the past ten years or so and have always stayed in four or five star hotels within the heart of the city. This year for a change we decided to stay a five to ten minute bus ride away from the bustling city centre and discovered a real gem of a hotel in the Westcord Art Hotel Amsterdam (4 star). From the moment we walked in the hotel, the hotel staff at reception made you feel very welcome. The check-in was quick and easy. Even though we arrived early in the afternoon, we were shown to the room so we could relax after our somewhat arduous journey (caused by KLM baggage drop off at Manchester Airport taking two hours just to drop our baggage off (after check in) and incorrect train directions by Tourist Information at Schipol Airport). Although we only had a 'Large Room', the room was honestly one of the best, most modern hotel rooms we had ever stayed in. A lot of thought has gone into the design of this room type and there was more than plenty of room for the two of us. We would have loved to have seen the 'Extra Large Rooms' you can book, just to see what they were like in comparison to this room. The room was well equipped. We brought our own travel iron and a hair dryer because in previous stays in hotels they are not either any available in the room or they are not very good, however, this was not the case this time. Even my wife was happy, apart from when I reminded her that I had carried them all the way from the UK and I would have to carry them all the way back! The bathroom was large, with a separate shower cubicle, bath and very large wash basin area. The bathroom had plenty of natural light, due to it being behind interior glass panel walls and there being two large windows in the room. The hotel bar area was a good size and provided the right atmosphere, whether you just wanted a drink or if you were having meals in there. The atmosphere was very friendly, aided by the very friendly bar staff. Even though we did not need them, the hotel management were always available to customers and we spotted them a number of times asking customers how there stay was and could they provide any additional help or advice. After staying in two five star hotels in Amsterdam centre in the past few years, (Grand Hotel Krasnapolski and Holiday Inn Crowne Plaza), these two hotels could do with visiting the Westcord Hotel Amsterdam 4 star and see how to really look after their customers/visitors. If the Westcord Hotel Amsterdam 4 star, is only a four star then in our mind these two five star hotels would not even rate as three star in comparison. Although on the face of things visitors to Amsterdam may want to stay in the very centre of Amsterdam, we found the 48 bus service from right outside the Westcord Hotel was very punctual and travels into and out of Amsterdam Central Station four time an hour. In addition, the majority of trains from Schipol Airport to Central Station in Amsterdam stop at Station Slotedijk. The 48 bus travels from outside Station Slotedijk (towards Central Station) and is around five minutes to the Westcord Hotel (Hempoint). This saves time in travelling into Amsterdam and then having to travel back to the hotel in order to check in etc. At the Tourist Information office at Schipol Airport, we purchased a 72 hour bus and tram pass, which also incorporated a return rail ticket to Central Station from Schipol Airport for just over 20 Euros. This is great value, as we are led to believe just a return rail ticket would cost around 7 Euros. We would definitely recommend the Westcord Hotel Amsterdam 4 Star to anyone wanting to visit Amsterdam. ENJOY.

Reviews.Title: “We go Amsterdam every year and this was the best hotel by far!”
Reviews.Author: bakerfamily_11
Reviews.Content: If you dont mind gettng a 10minute bus journey into amsterdam central then this is well worth booking. The rooms were spotless, modern and there were beautiful pieces of art everywhere. We even had a smoking room! We were suprised when we looked out of our window to find a giant swimming pool outside! The terrace bar was stylish and the food was yummy even though a little expensive. The bus stop is right outside or you can hire a bike.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent!”
Reviews.Author: millyweeble
Reviews.Content: We arrived here after staying at a 5 star hotel in Germany and thought the ratings should've been switched over! This hotel was quirky, interesting and most of all comfortable. The bathroom was to die for! We only stayed for one night and wished we could've stayed longer. Although it's a distance from the centre of Amsterdam, the public transport is so good there that it didn't really matter.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel stay of my life!”
Reviews.Author: VtravelqueenV
Reviews.Content: me and my partner decided to take a quick weekend trip to amsterdam. we were looking for a clean/simple/modern and well located hotel, within a budget. after some online searching we found a reasonably good (but not super cheap by any means) deal for this hotel. it was represented as a modern 'art hotel' located in a 'historic part' of amsterdam, this sounded perfect for a short 3 night stay. we were dissapointed as soon as we arrived, the hotel was only a stone's throw from the airport and nowhere near the city center or anything 'historical' other than old traintracks. the staff was rude, and insisted on 'blocking off' a certain amount on our credit-card on top of the already fully pre-paid room charge. the room looked modern and ok. we dropped off our luggage and went right off into town without a throrough room check (really regretted this later!) the bus ride to town took almost 20 minutes (do not even try walking to the center as the hotel is close to some pretty sketchy housing projects). we got back late-ish (after 1 am) after waiting for the night bus for almost 40 minutes (in hindsight should have just taken a taxi, but they are pretty expensive in amsterdam, and not all of them reliable). by the time we arrived the hotel entrance was locked, and the night concierge insisted on questioning us thoroughly via the door speaker (name, room number etc.) before opening the door. when he finally kindly chose to let us in we went straight to our room. while using the bathroom i realized that the sink was completely busted, and had to use the bathtub tap to wash my hands in, brush my teeth etc. then came the grand finale, as we unfurled the bed and took off the covers we found a (dry) yellow stain ans short black hairs staring right up at us. i was almost sick. i have never before seen something like this at any hotel (not even road side ones). i called the night porter and half hysterically insisted that he come up right now to see the state of the bedding. this was the same, unpleasant guy that questioned us before opening the hotel entrance, after seeing the (obviously unused but filthy) bed he looked embarassed and humbled and brought some clean sheets right away, changing the bed himself as there was no-one else in the hotel at the time. he apologized, and we retired to bed still seriously disgusted. the next morning we demanded to talk to a manager to discuss the issue of the sheets, but they wouldn't even apologize. i was shocked with the way the hotel staff behaved and the condition of the bed, it was all the more bizarre as the rest of the hotel was reasonably clean. needless to say i have learned my lesson from this and the first thing i do now before anything else in a hotel room is undo the covers and do a proper inspection of the bed and the cleanliness of any linens present.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel BUT disappointed”
Reviews.Author: braingal210
Reviews.Content: 1. this place is not really close to airport. (compare to any other hotels). Since it is not in city center, I do not recommend here for the city travellers. However, if you have a car and wants to stay distant from the city center, then it might be good to stay here. They said that there is shuttle service to the airport, but it coast 15 euros one way. This is not a hotel near airport at all! 2. I reserved the spot for 4 nights and ended up staying for 3 nights because of my flight was available a day before my actual departure. This is during the Icelandic Volcanic eruption period which affected lots of aircraft grounded for a week. So I wanted to get refunded for the last night that I will not be staying, but the hotel refused to refund me. Other services that you can get from the hotel is average (same as any other hotels in the world... I think this place is worth of 3 stars for the service). The amenity was actually really good. free wi-fi and tub in the room, a tub in the bath room which is rare in the european hotel... I think 3 people can stay easily in this room. However, the policy under a special case like the natural disasters was really disappointing..

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: shavethearea
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Amsterdam for a long weekend with my partner and friends for a cultural experience! Booked with lastminute.com the Amsterdam Art Hotel. This hotel is magical! Extremely modern and amazing rooms. Huge beds and stylish fixtures and fittings. Was able to park for free in the hotels underground carpark. The hotel is on the outskirts of amsterdam- we took a 10min bus ride into the city centre each day and i think this is the best option as the hotels in the centre looked awful!!! We didnt eat or drink at the hotel just slept off the excesses of the Amsterdam nightlife and for that this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryhopper29
Reviews.Content: I spent couple nights at this hotel last week and absolutely love it. The staff at the front desk are very helpful. I arrived the hotel before 9:00am and they let me have the room right away. I was expecting the usual "the room is not ready until 3:00pm" statement from most of the hotels that I stayed at in the past. If you are coming from the Schiphol Airport, it may be easier get off at the Amsterdam Sloterdijk train station instead of Amsterdam Centraal and catch the #48 bus from here. This way, you will arrive at the bus stop right in front of the hotel instead of the one across the road. While the road is not too busy, I found it challenging trying to hop across with my heavy luggages.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel,,,”
Reviews.Author: bullock6969
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 nights,, brilliant, wont look good as ur driving up to it but once u get ur room and meet the staff all well,, the room war bling,the bar is lovly and the staff are lovly what more wount u like,,, taxi from airport 40 euro. others were sayiny 20 but not true,, taxi to squar in 12.00 but buss right out side door for 2.50 each , handy for going in and taxi out after lots of beer,, i would deffently stay there again,bye from ireland

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the Art hotel 4* part of the building - not the older main building”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple of times now on business in Amsterdam. Price for accomodation its good value with moden rooms nicely renovated, but only if you stay in the 4* Art Hotel extension building. Parking is expensive at 22.50 Euros as of Feb 2010 in their garage, but less than paying 3 euros an hour to park on the street until midnight if you arrive early. Food in the bar restauaunt is OK but comparatively expensive, I would suggest eating out in a local restaurant for better value and probably food. Free internet (wired and wifi) in the room is good for business travellers. The hotel has recently been taken over by Westcord from Golden Tulip which doesn't really seem to have made a difference yet. The room I was in 338 was good but had a couple of rough edges (edge of desking was broken), so maybe Westcord are still getting their heads round the property. On business I would stay again, but also consider the newer (but slightly more expensive) Fashion Hotel in the same group not too far away. On Leisure I would stay more centrally.

Reviews.Title: “Inn portion is average”
Reviews.Author: hereidreamt
Reviews.Content: Unlike some of my colleagues, who were put up in the Art portion of the hotel, I slummed it in the Inn portion. Fairly standard European room--the two twin beds pushed together for a quasi-king and an industrial-chic stainless-steel bathroom. Minibar has sensors--which can be good or bad depending on your curiosity. I may have paid 3 times for the same bar of chocolate... The location is decent. Get a strippenkaart from the front desk and take the efficient bus to either Sloterdijk or Centrum.

Reviews.Title: “NICE COUSINE”
Reviews.Author: vinceblues
Reviews.Content: Good compromise between class/servicies, very good cousine and well connected with downtown, bus stop is just in front of the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and really nice hotel - we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Kokekan
Reviews.Content: We were as anyone is, apprehensive about booking a Top Secret hotel on Lastminute.com and when it turned out it was the Golden Tulip, and we looked up the reviews we were really happy! The hotel is really lovely and is the Four Star part of the combined hotel. The other half being the three star Tulip Amsterdam Art. Rooms were spacious and well decorated and clean and had A/C and tv and a king sized bed and a couch. The only strange parts were that the toilet was in a separate room to the bathroom at the other end of the room without a sink in it. The bathroom was separated from the rest of the room with glass modesty panels. If you're not a couple, this could be potentially embarassing :-) Getting to the hotel from the airport is easy and complicated at the same time as Schipoll isn't the most logically laid out airport and the signs are far and few between. When you come out of the arrivals hall and collected your bagage, go immediately towards the right to the Tourist Information Centre (not the Aiport Info Centre). There you can buy either an all transport pass which includes tickets on the train to Central Station or you could by an I Amsterdam pass which is good if you're visiting the museums and going on cruises and includes travel. From here, take the train which is fairly well signposted to Central Station - I think this is platform 2. It's a quick journey, around 15 minutes where you'll see all the other hotels that you could have booked but are really far out of town :-) When you get to Central Station, walk to the bus stops where you can get the number 48 or 22 bus. The 48 is preferable as it stops right outside the hotel. Take this bus for about 10 minutes (around 5 bus stops) and stop at Hempoint where if you look left, you'll see the Golden Tulip hotel). You have to cross a wide road but it isn't very busy - and you're there! :-) When you want to go back into town, take the 48 again and it will take you to Central Station -from here you can take any number of trams to various destinations all covered by your multi pass card you bought at the airport. Central Station have a left luggage area with lockers costing Euro 7.30 for 24hrs. Use these to leave your stuff and travel around the city centre when you have to leave the hotel if your flight is in the afternoon. I won't comment on the sightseeing suffice to say there is a LOT to see and two nights should be enough to see most of it - I wouldn't bother with the canal cruises as you can see everything from the streets anyway. All the museums are a must (not including the drug and sex museum as these are rubbish) and you must see the red light district for a laugh if nothing else! Foodwise - Amsterdam is quite expensive compared to the UK. Have breakfasts in bakeries and cafes, and lunch too perhaps and splurge out in the evenings in a nice restaurant. Expect to pay around Euro 50 for a meal for two including one drink each. These were pretty much all restaurants. The best ones we found are: The Pantry, Leidsekruisstraat 21, 1017 RE, Amsterdam, which serves the most AMAZING Dutch food (if you thought Dutch food was all cheese and crackers, think again!) - cannot recommend it enough! Lovely service too! Closest tram stop is Leidsplein and it's about a 5 min walk from there in the heart of the tourist-restaurant-land (but believe me, it is more traditional than rip off). The other good one we found which is slightly more expensive and further out but def worth visiting if you want to eat away from the tourists District V - http://www.district5.nl/index.php where you can find the address and details of how to get there. It is around 15-20 mins on tram from Central Station and around another 7 min walk from the tram stop (tram 25 or tram 3). One of the most amazing meals (taste-wise) we've had for a very reasonable price (64 Euros for two incl one drink each) but the quality of the food rivals those of a restaurant you would expect to pay around that price per head in the UK! Additionally, there are a few cafes in the main Dam Square worth a visit - the one next to the department store on the Canal is great! Amazing cakes! Hope you enjoy Amsterdam as much as we did - on and eat before you get to the airport as everything there is rip off including McDonalds (which I hate to say we had to resort to in the end). A dish of Spaghetti Bolognaise at Sbarro was 12 Euros! and that didn't include any meat!). Oh one more thing - you HAVE to try the chips in a cone place near the Diesel Store which is just off the main shopping street Kloverniers which is right next to the shopping centre closer to the southern end of the street! The queues go round the corner and you can choose from 24 toppings!!! Well worth it and probably the best fries I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel outside of City Center”
Reviews.Author: To_Be_Determined
Reviews.Content: As all the other reviews say, this hotel is outside of the city center. I liked the fact that it was away from the hustle of the center. There is the 22 and 48 bus that take you to the hotel but the 48 drops you off right out front of the hotel, take that one! Also, if you are going to be there for a few days, buy a GVB pass that lasts 24/48/72/etc... It will save you money and time. Even if it doesn't save you money, it's so easy to get on the busses and trains with it instead of having to buy a bus pass each time. I stayed in one of the rooms in the new part of the hotel. It was very nice and unique. The rooms were clean and had free wifi which is really nice. I would not recommend the hotel restaurant or bar. The food is not very good and the service isn't much better. Go into Amsterdam Center for some food. The noodles you can get on the street are amazing! Overall, this hotel is great to get outside of the city center but close enough to experience all of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “quiet hotel far from city center”
Reviews.Author: evalok
Reviews.Content: this was a clean and quiet hotel but far from city center, at least 2 mi from amsterdam central train station. I only recommend this place because we rented bikes and had bags that were easily transported on the bike. otherwise i would've liked staying closer to the center of the city. reception said walking into central would be 15 to 20 mins, which i think is reasonable if you're a speed walker. rooms were clean, staff friendly. our rates did not include breakfast (15 euro pp), which we skipped. this place has 2 pools, hotel is suitable for kids since you don't get the party crowd here. all in all, a nice place to stay if you don't mind being away from the action, have a car or bike and looking for peace and quiet. the bus does stop in front of the hotel but unless you like waiting for a ride, best bet is to choose a closer location.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Cathead_Fivel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found it ultra modern (we were in the new extension). The bathroom was very different as it had a glass wall. The shower was set back with glass doors for some privacy. You could watch tv while having a bath or shower, great! Toilet was in a seperate cubicle in the room. We wanted a base and found it perfect. The bus stop is outside and buses ran every 15 minutes. Sure it wasn't on the doorstep of the town centre but it was really just a 10 (if that) minute trip. The bus stop to get here is outside the main train station. Sure had to wait for the night bus but we have stayed in Amsterdam before and waiting for the night bus was nothing new. If you wanted to walk it would take about 40minutes. We didn't eat there but choose to get the bus into the centre. Staff were pleasant and helpful. No noise and a pool if you fancied a dip. More than adequate for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay if you dont mind the bus trip”
Reviews.Author: saihai
Reviews.Content: hotel prices seems to be incredibly high in amsterdam and after looking at reviews and prices of several places, we managed to book this hotel for just over Â£90 per night for 3 nights without breakfast. Rooms were really clean. staff were very polite and helpful. the only downside is that its not in the city but the bus ride to town did not take long at all, around 10 mins and the bus stops right in front of the hotel which is very convenient. the hotel also sells bus tickets. We did get ripped off by the taxi driver who charged us Eur25 from central station, he mentioned something about night rates but the hotel told us it should have only cost Eur14. Their website did mention they had a pool but i dont believe it was running when we were there but we did not get time to visit it anyways.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which is great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Shaf_One
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes away from the city centre and a bus stop right outside (No.48) makes the location very suitable, in fact at times you want to get out of the city as it is so busy. My only gripe of the hotel would be the beds are the old style flip ones which go into the wall so when they are laid out there is a gap between the bed and the wall, can make watching TV in bed very uncomfortable and the walls are very thin as well. However, rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “[--] of nowhere - but don't rule it out!”
Reviews.Author: csobs
Reviews.Content: Less than 24 hours before we were due to check in my wife discovered that I had not booked the Golden Tulip Hotel as I had intended but this one which every review accurately portrayed as stuck nowhere a tourist wanted to be. I tried unsuccessfully to get it changed. I wasn't going to eat 100 euros to cancel the whole booking and the travelocity guy never got back to me as he said he would. The result was we were going to take it but we weren't necessarily going to like it (as evidenced by my sulky childish 2 hours sleep attitude when we did eventually book in). Well the room was pretty damn nice I have to admit, big purple sofa along the whole of the window side of the room, the double bed was a bit odd. Two single beds pressed tight together but in every other respect :- duvets, sheets etc. two single beds. Another nice thing was the separation of the toilet and the bath/shower room. For anyone married to someone who likes to bring a book to the loo (like for example, my wife) having access to the hair dryer, shower and big mirror can get difficult. On that subject, the mirror in the shower room must have had rear heating as it never steamed up, a really great idea which I had never seen before and I must admit would have gone unnoticed had my wife not brought it to my attention. Actually if you saw my hair most days you wouldn't find it all that surprising. Okay if you are going to stay in this hotel you need to know a few things though. I'll bullet-point them as that looks nicer:- 1. Buy a GVB ticket in the white tourist building outside the train station. We bought one for 96 hours it was 18 euros each and that is an absolute bargain. 2. Apparently you can get a 22 bus which we did the first day and I'll give the driver his dues, without us telling him where we were going he stopped and told us "The Golden Tulip is up there 150yds!" He has obviously seen a lot caught like us. Forget the 22, it's a b*llocks walking those 150 yds needlessly. You want the 48 and you want to get off at Hempoint. The hotel is the one across the dual carriageway with the stupid cows out front. There are no crossing facilities but it isn't so busy that you are risking your life to get across. The stop for getting back in town is also very close to the hotel but smells very strongly of p*ss which I find odd for an open-air bus-stop. I suspect someone with a weak bladder gets off at this stop late at night, Monday to Friday. During our 4 day stay possibly the same person also managed to lose a pair of shoes one night and an umbrella the next. Which tells you another thing about Amsterdam, there may not be great street hygiene but the beer is bl*ody good. 3. Having done Anne Frank's house before and I have to say it is the best thing to do in Amsterdam, this time we went to the Rijksmuseum (very, very good), Bols experience (close to the Rijksmuseum and actually pretty good. You'll get the admission price in alcohol alone believe me), Resistance Museum (really interesting - make sure you take the headphones which are free but without my eagle-eyed wife the ladies-who-lunch at the counter weren't for mentioning it - oh you'll need ID in case you run away with the headphones or whatever), Canal tour - we took the 100 things to see one, there are probably 1000's of things to see however the commentary which was recorded, only mentioned a dozen or so, last time we took the night time wine and cheese tour which was great. I drank the admission and I'm sure my wife had a damned good attempt, never mind the cheese. Last time we were in Amsterdam we went to the Van Gogh museum which also was really worth doing. 4. You really need to try and familarise yourself with the trams and buses in Amsterdam. You can get a map in the white tourist building mentioned earlier outside the train station. Blue lines are buses and if you look along the line you see the numbers which traverse that line, red lines are trams and follow the same rules. If you master that you have Amsterdam at your beck and call. 5. Behind the Rijksmuseum (the other side from the Vondelpark and across the canal bridge) is a street I have no idea of its name but it is full of galleries and antique dealers. Really nice one to peruse. 6. Again I have no idea of the street but Dam Square has a great little street of restaurants etc. We went to Gauchos one night, it was really expensive but we were on holiday so what the hell. It's not real life on holiday. We had a look at the menu, I was going to get a steak at 40 euros and the sides were extra! There was a slight problem in that we were very close to the front door and were getting very cold from the draught. I asked the waitress if we could move to the tables against the side of the room from the draught. I have to admit they were tables for 4 however there were quite a few not taken and it was getting quite late. I'm not usually quick to ire however she replied " NO, you can go to this one" (indicates table beside ours). I reacted without thinking and went to leave immediately but then felt a bit embarrassed that my wife may have felt differently so we had a short discussion during which the waitress "explained" to our slow types that we could take the table ( 2 seater beside us still in the draught) but we would have to wait until they had cleaned it. Lovely wife told them where to stick it and we went to the steak house literally opposite. Much cheaper and genuinely the best steak I have ever had. 7. Wagamama is bloody great, you'll find it off Leidesplein. By the way look out for the hotel discount cards they look like mini postcards - they will get you at least a beer in Wagamama (per card). 8. For some reason it costs at least 30 cents for a p*ss in Amsterdam toilets, this is even in bars and some restaurants. This is how much it was it was in the department store off Dam Square don't know it's name but basically get off the 4.9.16.24 or 25 bus from Central Square and take the first stop and the shop is to your East. It has about 5 floors and it has a brilliant restaurant at the top. Trust me, it is great - not necessarily cheap but you're on holiday, you can't be cheap either. I suppose I should finish with the hotel. We never ate in it, small choice and looked dear, but if you are the type who go on trips to see the city and want a comfortable bed at night with a reasonable degree of luxury this hotel will do the job. The bus is only ten minutes and you need the tickets to get anywhere in Amsterdam anyway. Check the price of this hotel with the hotel in the area you want and if there is a reasonable saving, take this hotel, you never wait more than ten minutes for a bus and the ride as I said is only ten minutes. Internet was expensive, we didn't bother, I think the lobby will give you a keyboard and there is free wifi (possibly). There is a very good chance we will be back to this hotel if it is cheaper than anywhere more central.

Reviews.Title: “high standard 4-star hotel at a cheap price, with smoking rooms, a little far from the center”
Reviews.Author: Tea-bagger69
Reviews.Content: I accidental booked this hotel instead of its sister hotel in the center of town. However, the price was much cheaper and the hotel seems to be very new with a high standard of rooms with no hidden costs, i.e. free wi-fi, tea coffee facilities in room. Also, this was one of the only hotel that i could find that has smoking rooms :) very useful in amsterdam ; ) The only down-side to staying at this hotel is the distance from the center, about 4km but there is a bus stop right out side the hotel (No 48 or 22 just round the corner) which take 5-10mins to get into town and cost only 2 euros. There are two hotels on the same site; Inn and Art hotels - so it's easy to get confused when booking.... Overall very clean, the check in staff all speak perfect English and are very helpful and friendly, a very good 4-star hotel at 3-star prices... Two good sized outdoor swimming pools, a bit cold this time of year but would be great for the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, can become really good with some attention”
Reviews.Author: mdeboer
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks lovely, modern, new. Personnel could be a bit more attentive. I got a door key, which did not work, had to go all the way back to the reception, got a new key, which did not work again. The breakfast looks nice enough, but the warm dishes were all not warm, but just off-cold. Dirty dishes were not taken off the table. At 17 euro for breakfast, I expected a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: madjt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights whilst attending a conference. Hotel was on the conference recommended list and was booked on trust. I was worried that it might be too far out of the city centre to be useful, but found myself enjoying the 20 minute walk to and from the city each day, experiencing picturesque and less touristy parts of Amsterdam. Hotel looked a little weird upon arrival, but found the room to be excellent and clean with nice amenities. Staff were helpful and mostly pleasant, breakfast varied and plentiful. Overall a very nice, if not slightly out of the way, hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boring, institutionalised and too far from town”
Reviews.Author: N_McL
Reviews.Content: For all the trendy artwork and the chic decoration, this place can't hide the fact that it's boring. It's clean, freshly decorated and convenient for a number of businesses but it's too far from the heart of Amsterdam. Taxis take ages to arrive and cost â‚¬15-20 to get in. I really hated the electronically locked front doors that mean you need to summon assistance to get in or out, day or night. Can only recommend for travellers that need to sleep then get to the office early.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnsfzr
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the new wing of the hotel and the room was superb. the only disappointing thing was the one and only evening meal we had, so we went into town to eat from then on. the hotel is out of town as previous reviews have stated, but the bus stops outside the hotel and the journey is not too long at all. buy a 24 hour ticket from reception for about 7 euros. we would definately stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: tainadelcaribe
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for 4 days and it was grea. It was one of the best 2 hotels I have stayed in and it was less than $200 per night. This hotel is very modern and beautiful. Super clean with friendlly staff. Staff is fluent in english (in Amsterdam pretty much everyone is). Very nice restaurant. There is a separate cafe/snack/bar, the entrance is right in the lobby. This hotel is artsy, like the name suggests with very nice paintings in display. It's 2 hotels in one and they are connected through a hallway with glass walls and ceiling. The "second lobby" (just very nice chairs and sofas it it) is super modern with chairs shaped like hands, I loved it. Elevator looks like new, stairs are very attractive with glass steps and the carpet in the hallway was a beautiful deep purple. The rooms are super modern and with very bright colors. They are named: Rock, Sand, Metal, Water and 2 more names that I can't remember. (There is not just 5 rooms,the names repeat) My room was 125 Rock and it was red, purple and white (loved it). The room had free Wi Fi and welcome personalized TV screen with 'Movies on Demand' and music you can choose according to your mood. TV has very useful info menu with information and itineraries for different tourist attractions, might life, drinkning and dinning, suggested itineraries with activities to do and city facts. The room was comfortable (not too big, not to small) with a white desk, very comfortable bed (one of those you cand push against the wall and it looks like a closet. The bathroom (spotless clean) was very comfortable with tub and separate shower. 2 outside pools and lounging area, one of the pools is perfect for children. The restaurant has a little outside area facing the pool. Comfortable, secure underground parking lot. Hotel is 3 miles away from city center. Bus stop right in front of the hotel (we didn't use the car at all) with buses coming every 15-20 minutes. Fot those who like Burger King, there is one 3 minutes away by car. In all it is very nice and I would definately recommend it and stay there again. I wish I could share more pictures so everybody can see why I liked it so much, too bad I could only share 10! I hope you find this review and pictures helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but Too far out of centre”
Reviews.Author: Busnsandpleasure
Reviews.Content: I see there are mixed reviews for this hotel but I thought it was beautiful. My room was very modern and comfortable, the food was great (rare to get a decent full English outside the UK) and the only issue was with the distance from the city centre. However this was not bad enough to spoil the holiday. There are plenty buses and taxis, and on one occasion we walked it too (took around an hour at strolling pace). This was the only compromise. I do agree that the staff could have been quicker and warmer but in terms of standard of accommodation I liked this hotel a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, very well decorated, good price but not well located for turism”
Reviews.Author: fabriceetpaola
Reviews.Content: The decoration inside is really original, modern art everywhere. The construction of the rooms also is original and I have to say this is quite a success. The price is good bearing in mind that this is not far from Ams center. However the location is not great...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bully1959Canaries
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel but location is poor for the centre of Amsterdam. Nice and quiet hotel close to the main bus route into town which takes 10 mins. Good food and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place”
Reviews.Author: HenkEindhoven
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good place to stay when visiting amsterdam, just outside the centre, but hey....amsteram is no new york, within 15 minutes your are at the Dam. Rooms are beautifull en comfortable. Bathroom is ok. Hospitality is typically dutch......decent, but nothing more than that.

Reviews.Title: “rooms to hot, staff not helpfull, quite depressing”
Reviews.Author: wendyharris62
Reviews.Content: didnt enjoy our stay at all, the rooms were so hot we became very dehydrated, tv was not working properly so could not get any music channels or english language, wi-fi also not working so was bored in room when in. staff would say one thing and do another, also on two occasions were accused of taking things from mini bar which we had only just moved to get to something else but on saying that we over heard other visitors complaining about the same thing. would definatly not stay at any golden tulip hotels again and definatly would not recomend it to any friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Time At The Amsterdam Art”
Reviews.Author: cazzaBirmingham
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 night stay at the Amsterdam Art. Having read previous reviews, we knew the hotel was situated out of town, that said, the public transport was fantastic. You can catch the number 48 bus to central station, which is right in the heart of the city centre. These buses stop right outside the hotel, and run approx every 15min up to midnight, when the night bus takes over and runs every half an hour.The journey into the city centre takes approx 8mins. Our room in the hotel was fab, and looked just like the pictures on the website. We had a superkingsize bed, and the bathroom was fantastic. There was not much of a view, but realistically how long do you stay in your room for? Tea & coffee facilites were available, but we did have to ask for extra tea/coffee/sugar etc, as these did not seem to get replenished very regulary. We didn't eat in the hotel, as this was quite expensive compared to restuarants in the city centre, I do feel that for the price you are paying for this hotel, breakfast should be included, but you have to pay an extra 15euro's each for breakfast. We bought travel passes at reception which can last for 24/48/72 hrs, our 3day pass allowed us to use the buses & trams anytime and cost 10.50euro's each. The canalbus was also really enjoyable, and is a nice way to see Amsterdam along the various canals, they stop at regular tourist attractions, Anne Frank House etc. You can just jump on & off as you like. A 24hr canalbus pass cost 18euro. We really enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam & the hotel was clean, and provided good room facilites. I personally felt however that the hotel lacked character & atmosphere, but the staff during our stay were very friendly & welcoming. The hotel bar stays open until about 1.00am. A taxi to/from the airport will cost you approx 40-45 euro's and takes about half an hour. I would go back to the Amsterdam Art, as you are conveniently located to the city centre, but you do not have to deal with the noise/traffic that staying in the heart of Amsterdam would bring. The red light district is an eye-opener, and is located about 10mins walk from central station. Overall a fantastic 3day stay, I would reccommend, as long as you don't mind using the buses.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: june1972
Reviews.Content: I have just started using tripadvisor, and even though my stay at the 'golden' tulip was a few months ago me and my partner had such a horrible experience there that I felt compelled to review it. I am sure that thanks to the staff's attitude things have not changed for the better anyway. Ok let's start from the beginning, we booked a hotel and flight deal with lastminute.com so naturally the hotel was fully pre-paid. When we arrived from the airport by cab, I already started feeling uncomfortable since I realized we were nowhere near the city center (even though the hotel claims to be in the 'historic district of Amsterdam'), as I prefer to stay in convenient locations this already made me a little uncomfortable. However since it was all pre-paid we knew that we did not have any other choice but to stay there.
