When we got to the concierge desk another surprise followed, as I said our 4-day stay was entirely pre-paid but the concierge (after making us wait for about 15 minutes for him to finish some typing) insisted on 'blocking' a 2 day charge on my credit card 'in case of any unforeseen circumstances'. Now this had NEVER happened to me at any 4 star hotel before and I have been to plenty. I tried to make my claim that this is not necessary but he insisted, finally tired out I handed over my card, needless to say this severely crippled my holiday budget. After quickly dropping off our luggage at the room (and making the mistake of not checking it properly) we decided to go into town for some much needed food. We walked about the red-light district where we found a surprisingly delicious Chinese/Tibetan restaurant (best Chinese food I have ever had, beats Hakkasan!) and at about 10pm we decided to go back to our hotel. After waiting for the night bus for about 40 minutes, and a 20 minute ride through the generally sketchy neighborhood the hotel is around (it's next to a train depository) we finally arrived to be greeted by not so welcoming closed doors to the hotel. After ringing the night-bell for about another 10 minutes, as well as shouting and banging on the door, the night-porter finally decided to appear and let us in (of course only after asking to see our key and id-ing us!). The next fab surprise awaited us in our room, as I said we did not give the room a thorough check when we first arrived, which since this hotel I make sure to conduct EVERY time. The shock came when I lifted the bedspread to find a yellow stain with hairs on it on the otherwise white bedding, I was literally in shock. NEVER in my life had I expected to see something like this in a 4 star hotel, probably even a roadside motel would not allow something like this. After calling down to reception and screaming at the night-porter he came up and changed the bedding himself as there was noone else in the hotel at the time, granted he did look quite embarrassed and was apologetic. After getting over my disgust I decided to go use the washroom, where I realized the sink drain was broken and leaking, so we had to brush our teeth in the shower. Throughout our 4 day stay there it was not fixed. When I complained to the daytime concierge he pretty much just raised an eyebrow at me and could not even apologize in a decent manner. My trip to Amsterdam was almost ruined by this hotel, the waste of time on long commuting to the center of town, the rude staff, the disrepair and filth shocked me. I would have gone mad if not for the generally fun city, good food and great company of my partner. I strongly urge people to stay away from this hotel, I wouldn't board my dog there if I had one!

Reviews.Title: “Great stylish hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: hingefactor
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the last minute, and I'm very glad I did so. Although it's location is a bit outside of the city center, getting there via bicycle was easy and quick. Definitely not a walk though. The staff was great, the restaraunt was above average for a hotel and the room was wonderful. My room had a couch the ran along one complete side of the room and it was super comfy to hang out on while winding down from a day in the city. The bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was to die for. I took a nice long, hot bath each of my 3 days there. As an added bonus, there's also a beautiful and huge outdoor pool. I'd recommend this hotel to anybody. Gettting to and from it by bicycle is definitely the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: caughtthetravelbug
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Art is a little bit outside of the city centre which does restrict you to following bus timetables, however there are busses every half hour which drivers who love their city and love giving you tips for stuff to see and do! At nighttime we felt perfectly safe travelling on the night bus back. The actual hotel is lovely, very clean and modern. The bathroom is just amazing, probably my favourite part about the whole hotel to be honest! What did concern me was the fact that we had a double bed, which was actually two singles pushed together with two single duvets. What was strange was that there was no space for the beds to be seperated to convert into a twin room, so we didn't really understand that. Apart from the beds, I don't have anything to fault the hotel about to be honest, it was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Art? Thats a matter of opinion”
Reviews.Author: yaamsa
Reviews.Content: Booked & paid to stay for two nights(late April 07), 6 weeks prior to departure. Arrived at 12 midnight due to plane delay and was told that our room had been sold. ( very annoyed at this as payment had already been made). However, the staff assured us that the room was free the following night and offered an upgrade. They arranged and paid for taxis too and from The Golden Tulip Hotel which they had arranged for us to stay in overnight. Building work and traffic noise woke us at 6 am. We were promised our room would be ready for us at around 10 am. At 1pm the room was still not ready. We spoke with the General Manager who offered us a further upgrade and comlementary breakfast. In conclusion, a pleasant and clean hotel spoilt by poor business practices. All too common I'm afraid!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy just outside the city center”
Reviews.Author: Wordelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the golden tulip Amsterdam Art for the Easter week-end. Although the price is a little high, the hotel by itself is very comfortable. We had a large room in grey and purple, very cosy and comfortable. The bathroom has glass walls (shy people, be warned) but is large enough and clean. The view is not pleasant as it is a train warehouse but with little activity and, with the window closed, you can sleep comfortably. The only negative point is the mattress: although the bed is very large, the mattress is too soft. For breakfast, you can get the buffet but, for 15â‚¬ per person, it is a little expensive, especially when you consider all the nice places for breakfast you can find in Amsterdam. We did not tried the Restaurant. There seems to be a swimming pool but it was too early in the season to try it. The location of the hotel needs attention: if you're looking for a place above a canal, go somewhere else. It is a little outside the historic center near a commercial area. The access is nevertheless quite easy with 1 bus stop at the footstep of the hotel (one bus every 10-45 minutes to the central station) and you can take a 5 minute walk to another bus line the goes to the center. There is even a night bus running from midnight to 6AM. Be careful, there is also a tulip inn at the same address, do not get mixed up while booking.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: jooleywooley
Reviews.Content: Would recomend this hotel to anyone, we stayed in the 4* golden tulip amsterdam art, the rooms were just about the best i have EVER stayed in and well worth the bit extra you pay. Totally spotless, tastfully decorated, modern, sexy, comfortable and well equipped. Staff all spoke excellent english, were VERY helpful with tips on buses to catch, places to go etc, we booked shuttle bus to return to airport but it didn't turn up, reception staff rang the company and arranged for a private car to be sent out to us so we would still make our flight. All done with a smile and at no extra cost. We paid 15 euros each for breakfast when we were there and the choice is amazing, crackers, meats, cooked breakfast, breads, croissants, various jams and spreads, cereals, fruits, yoghurts, the list was endless and you could eat as much as you liked so a good breakfast would set you up for the day! Had drinks i the bar each evening, again good service, we only stayed for two nights, took my hubby for his birthday present, he didn't want to leave!!! said it was the BEST prezzie i have EVER got him. Thanks to all on here who have posted other reviews, the useful info on bus services, directions to hitel etc were VERY helpful, so i advise anyone reading this to take the time to read through ALL the reviews coz there is some really good info on here which will come in VERY usefull during you trip. I know i have waffled on but i hope this is helpful, if you are going here, you are in for a lovely stay! We will most definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Combination!”
Reviews.Author: TheTester
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend are travelling a lot in The Netherlands for business-reasons. Sometimes we stay one or two nights in Amsterdam. The city has a wonderful atmosphere and it is not important, what time of the year it is. When going there we are usually travelling by a large van. That ist the big problem when choosing a place to stay in Amsterdam. There are some nice hotels in the city center, but no place to leave Your car - and parking in a lot is mostly more expensive than the night in the hotel. This time we looked for a comfortable place which is not too far off with the possibility to park our large van. So I choosed the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art and booked a double-room for the cheap rate of EUR 79,-. On the next day we were very curious about what we would find there. First PRO: Parking. There is a big parking right at the hotel and for bigger cars as ours it is possible to park right in front of the entrance without problems. Second PRO: The hotel itself and the rooms are very clean. Checkin was friendly and quick. The room was very nice with the stylish bathroom behind glass. Other than in most other hotels, the toilet is a seperate room, what ist "sometimes" more comfortable in glassed bathrooms ;-) Third Pro: The location. OK - the hotel is not in the city center. But right in front of the entrance is the bus-stop and line 48 will bring You to the centre and main station in a few minutes. And it also brings You back until late in the night. Of course, You can also use a taxi. Perfect combination: If You are looking for a really nice hotel with quiet and comfortable rooms, a good connection to the center and no parking-problems; and that all for a very good price - this is the choice! Before that we stayed at the Swissotel (no parking), some more times at the Bilderberg Jan Luyken (walk and ride), and the Bilderberg Garden Hotel, which was some kind of old fashioned with no usable connection to the center, but a taxi. Next time we will choose the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art again. It is the perfect combination in Amsterdam, concerning location, comfort and price! Lucky stay, Oliver

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...”
Reviews.Author: RalphyBear
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel.... Came here for 4 days over the August Bank Holiday, and I was really impressed. Check in was quick and effortless, the room was amazing, massive bed, glass bathroom with seperate bath, seperate shower, seperate toilet, Massive mirror... There is a pool which you can use which is at the back of the hotel, it is a very large but a very cold pool but well worth a visit. The view wasn't the best in the world but you don't need a view when you've got a wonderful room. Reception where more than willing to order a taxi for us into the centre, which we did a couple of times, other times we walked it, it was a couple of miles into the centre but a very pleasant walk. Breakfast was amazing buffet style but all you can eat, such a varied selection This hotel would have to rate as one of the best hotel's i've ever stayed in...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: josietoms
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel well worth a visit. The hotel is in immaculate condition and very clean. The reception is very efficient and business like not over friendly but the staff in the hotel bar were very friendly. The room is a great size and the bathroom is a great added feature with the glass walls. I wouldnt bother with the breakfast as although it is lovely and plentiful it is very expensive compared to what you can get if you go out and about - we only had breakfast on the first morning. The food in the hotel restaurant is also expensive although we didnt eat there. The hotel is about a 10 min bus journey from right outside the hotel and they leave every 15 mins until midnight. This is the number 48. The number 22 also goes near the hotel about a 2 minute walk from the nearest stop. 24 hour tickets can be purchased from reception. A great hotel for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “The pictures are a lie”
Reviews.Author: lippydog
Reviews.Content: After looking at the pictures on a few sites like expedia we thought it looked like a lovely place to spend a romantic weekend. It mentioned that it was on the border of the city when infact it was a good 10 min bus ride from central station. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable but the decor just seemed to be lacking in the flair that was advertised. The main restaurant was very expensive with mains starting at 25 to 35 euros plus, which seemed very expensive for not being in the heart of town. Overall a good budget place if you dont mind some hard excercise into town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: forestpaul
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, only thing was that the glass bathroom is not availible in the XL rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Kyle19835
Reviews.Content: we have hust returned from a three night stay at the hotel. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful offering information on how to get into town and what bus to get. The room was very clean, maid comes in daily with sheets and towels changed every other day or every day upon request. Location was very good. It was approximately 15-20 minutes from the airport in a taxi which costs 38 euros. The location of the hotel was also good in relation to town. It takes a 10 minute bus ride into town. The bus stop is just outside the hotel, and the number 48 bus will take you to central station for 2.40 euros. However, if you walk further down the road towards the BP garage there is another bus stop, from which both number 22 and 48 buses stop. The rate from the bus stop to central st is 1.60 euros due to different zone. We can definitely recommend the daily 4 hour tours of the city which depart at 11am and 3pm from opposite Central Station and outside the tourist information centre. The tour is free and is a brilliant way of finding out information about the city. There is also a 10 euro 3 hour tour of the red light district which departs from the same place at 6.45 which we really enjoyed. We really enjoyed our trip to Amsterdam and the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art will definitely be going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok if You're On a Budget”
Reviews.Author: AnAmericanTourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little just ok if you are in a budget. However, it wasn't that cheap either, but hotels in Amsterdam are not very affordable in general. The location of the hotel was a little away from the Centraal Station and the main street, Damrak. You have to take the #48 bus to the Hempoint stop. A day pass costs â‚¬6,30. If you stay closer to the center, you could walk to most sights. Be aware that at times this bus does not always run every 10 minutes. Only during peak times. Also, the bus passes by a bridge that rises to allow ships to pass by. This can lengthen your commute to and from Centraal Station. The bus does seem generally timely, so obtain a schedule from the transportation information office across the street of Centraal Station. The bus drops you off in front of the hotel, but across the street from it. There isn't a close by cross walk, so we had to jay walk to the hotel. Most of the time, there isn't a lot of cars on this street, but sometimes, there can be some cars speeding down the street. The area around the hotel is quiet, it looks like it is on the edge of an industrial/business part of town. There isn't much around the hotel, so you can't find restaurants, supermarkets, or convenience stores around. You have to get this in the main part of town. The hotel itself is just ok. The staff at the hotel was not very attentive or courteous. They were busy talking to each other rather than worrying about helping us check in. They even served people that were behind us first and took calls first before talking to us. We had to flag someone down before they helped us. It seems like the staff early in the morning is much more friendly and helpful than the middle of the day. They even asked if we needed a cab after checkout in the morning. The rooms were generally clean and ok size, for European standards. You had some room to move around. However, the furniture was not made of high quality materials. The counters in the room were plastic, like the types in hospitals. The carpeting was a bit worn. The ceiling of our bathroom was made of plywood and didn't have great workmanship. The bathroom was small.. They did not have a shower curtain in the shower, only a slim clear plastic panel that left 3/4 of the shower open to the rest of the bathroom. Unfortunately, if you angle your showerhead the wrong way or if you plan to splash at all, you can get your bathroom floor all wet. The bathroom was generally clean, except some edges of the bathtub had mold stains on it. An unusual aspect of this hotel is that they tried to decorate it in a whimsical artsy manner. Pieces of cheap furniture is accompanied by large paintings in the room. The rooms reminded me of dorm rooms. The decor was unusual with a stainless steel sink that looked like a kitchen sink, a decorated bathroom mirror, plain white tile on the walls, and black tiles on the floor. The beds were arranged oddly. The twin beds in one of our rooms were pushed very close together. Only 6 inches separate the two beds. They also did not change our sheets daily as requested either. If you are looking for a basic, clean (for the most part), unusually decorated place to stay on a bit of a budget, stay here. Otherwise, if you can find a better place to stay, you should go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: GOLDKT10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled to Amsterdam mid early July and thought this hotel was really nice. We do the City Break thing frequently and normally stay in 'base' hotels, clean, good location but pretty basic. We expected Amsterdam Art to be the same but it is a real 4* hotel, really contemporary modern rooms, great location (10 mins from centre) however bathooms are made with glass doors and walls so dont expect any private bathroom time but shower is wonderful, rooms are spotlessly clean!! The whole hotel is lovely and restaurants looked great, usual hotel prices so we didnt eat in them but they looked nice. There is also a pulic pool surrounded by grass area right behind the hotel which I think you have to pay for which looked nice too. Only negtive that some people might find is that on the smoking floors (of which we were on) the coridoors had a constant cannibis smell (I know expected from Amsterdam) but the room itself was fine! General tips for Amsterdam we would have like to have known!: The hotel is around a 40 min travel time in all from Schipol airport and the best way to do it is get the train form SCHIPOL AIRPORT to CENTRAAL STATION which costs aroung 4 euros per single ticket and the from centraal station get the 48 bus and get of at HEMPOINT not Spaarndammerdijk this is what we did and you have to walk back to the hotel as HEMPOINT stops RIGHT outside. If you are intending to use public transport throughout your stay Id suggest buying a travelcard type ticket which you can use on buses, trams and tue (we didnt use the tube as its more for long journeys not around the main town). Buy it from the tourist office opposite Centraal station as you come out not one of the machines and its around 13 euros for 48 hours (also get it stamped on your first bus.tram as it needs to be validated) If you are going out at night the last 48 bus from the hotel goes at around midnight, after that you can get the 353 bus in and out of town and back to Hempoint until 6am when the 48 runs again. Nightclubs (actual dance clubs) seemed pretty scarce as most places are 'coffee shops' and bars, we wanted an rnb type club and the only one in the whole of AMsterdam (that we found and trust me we looked very hard!) was called MINISTRY this is the webite for address etc [---------]it could have been really good with good music and ok venue but the people were just pretty boring, not the kind of mad atmosphere in say Berlin for example, it was just all very stand around and do nothing than dancing and getting an atmosphere going, however we were told there were a few other places but unfortunaltey for us they were midweek places or thur/fri, these were La Rumba & Sinners. Its worth going to though it may have just been a quiet night when we went? Re the Red Light District, hhhmm good to go and say 'yes I have been there, seen it', but thats about it, very seedy and sleazy, groups of lads perving in glass windows at scarily young looking girls in bikinis trying to usher them in, that sort of thing, pick careully your time of going to check this part out best time would probably be 9-11 where its very touristy more of a laugh, couples, hen parties etc, whereas after 1 onwards its the ppl that are there to experience it first hand and not just as a tourist attraction if you know what I mean, ladies its pretty uncomfortable walking around that area at this time. During the day Amsterdam is a really pretty area and very flat so walking is easy! Its not that cheap so take plenty of spending money and be sure to do a canal cruise and the shopping is pretty good to! Everyone rides bikes so look out as you are walking as they have priority over pedestrians and it is really easy to rent them if you fancy getting around that way! Obviously if you are a smoker (we''re not) but we could see it would be heaven on earth for smokers (yes not cigarettes) as its i so chilled out and freely available! Hope this review is helpful and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading various mixed reviews about this hotel we were not sure what to expect. Our flight arrived in Amsterdam at 9am and we thought we would't be able to check in till 2pm. We arrived at the hotle around 10am & we were able to check in there & then, which was a touch! We did have to pay a 200 euros deposit on arrival. Ok if you've got a card but not if your having to pay out of your spending money. The rooms are brillant value & we love the way they have been designed & decorated, very modern, very sheek. Classy, comfy & clean what more can u ask for! The food is really nice and good value for money. The hotel is about 10-15 mins bus ride from Amsterdam centre or 1/2 hr walk, there is a BP garage 5 mins away very handy when ur walking home at 2am and you've got the munchies, again! The only thing im gutted with is not taking my bikini, no one metioned theres 2 public (out door) swimming pools in the garden area that hotel guest can use as well and the sun was out all 4 days we were there. CTx

Reviews.Title: “Golden Tulip amsterdam art”
Reviews.Author: whizbird85
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from The Golden Tulip amsterdam art (and to clear things up the Golden Tulip is the 4* but you check in in the 3* amsterdam art's lobby) The Hotel was very clean, and the rooms were modern with nice lighting features etc.The bathroom was a nice idea too, with the glass wall, perhaps not a good idea if you werent a couple! The only thing that bothered me was the two single beds made to be a double, they kept seperating in the night and id end up in the hole in the middle lol. Oh and dont expect a nice view-but i wasnt there for that! The food is a lil fussy in the restaurent and not much of a choice, however the bar had a warm and welcoming atmosphere, but i think the barman fancied my boyfriend O_o. Amsterdam as a whole was a fun and intriguing place to visit and was easy to get around coNsidering its such a bustling city. Oh and another thing the hotel recommends the 48 or the 22 bus. Donnot take the 22 bus, depending where u get it you can end up in the middle of nowhere and making a 10 minute journey into an dhour and 20 minute trip. And we also had a problem with getting the shuttle bus, the company that you book at the hotel, they didnt turn up to get us back to the airport and hadnt informed the hotel, which was unwanted worry for your last day (however this wasnt the hotels fault-just a warning!)

Reviews.Title: “would recommend to anyone.......”
Reviews.Author: frankie24
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam and stayed at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art, I would recommned this hotel to anyone and everyone. After months and months of looking for the right hotel I chose this one, and was very nervous like we all are when we arrived, but we were more than happy with the results! Although the outside of the building looks a bit like a block of flats, the inside more than made up for it. The whole building was spotlessly clean, the staff were brilliant, helpfull, and happy. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the beds (like someone else said in their review) were the most comfortable i have ever slept in, in a hotel. The breakfast was lovely, loads of choice. We loved everything about it. The distance to the centre of everything is 5 mins in a bus, the bus stop is outside the hotel (number 48) there are 4 an hour. We didnt acutually walk it because we done so much walking around the centre, but i reckon you could walk it in 20 mins. We absolutly loved Amsterdam and cant wait to go back there again. any questions please email me and ill help if i can carla.johnson@beerseller.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: tamraisrki
Reviews.Content: Living in the Netherlands for some time, I have learned that here even 5 star hotels dont feel like 5 star hotels in other countries. So, dont expect too much from any hotel here! (for instance, they are not changing towels every day- save the planet by using less detergents...)The nice thing about this one is that it is new and clean, nothing too specail, a bit far from the center. If i want to be too picky, our room was having doors on one wall and they were too thin, so that our neigbour was waking us up while sitting on a toilete seat. But, in total, one of the best moderate-budget hotels i visited in Netherlands. have fun and DOEI!

Reviews.Title: “top place”
Reviews.Author: diggler
Reviews.Content: just stayed at this great hotel , very friendly staff , slighty outside centre ( 10 mins in taxi , 10 - 15 euros ) lovely rooms and nice bar . Would recommend this to anyone who wants value for money , c u soon amsterdam !!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Exo
Reviews.Content: For the cost of this hotel, I expected a little bit more as far as the service level. Every time I interacted with the front desk, they seemed a little rude and didn't want to take the time to make sure their guests were satisfied. For example, I called the first day to get an iron sent up. I called they front desk and was told "they're all out <click>". The second day I had to call 3 times to get them to finally send the iron up. The room was adequate, but I ended up with a sore back because the mattress was worn out. It was clean and the bathroom was a decent size. It wasn't horrible, but I wouldn't stay here again. I would pay a little more and stay further into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elpoca
Reviews.Content: Clean with large rooms. Our room was, in fact, two rooms: one with the bed and TV, the other with a hide-a-bed. We didn't pay extra for this, but aren't sure if all rooms have the additional room. Front desk service for us was very friendly and helpful. As noted in the other reviews, it is a little out-of-the-way. It would be a long (45 minute) walk from downtown to the hotel. There are, of course, two regular and one night bus run to it from Centraal train (transit) station. However, in our experience, the buses were invariably late. In any case, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, when I arrived in Centraal and saw how much rubbish lined the streets I wanted to turn round and go home, but when we finally made it to our hotel and checked in I was more than happy to stay. The hotel is lovely. Wasn't too keen on the two single beds pushed together (with two single duvets) - not hugely romantic, but that was my only gripe, so it can't be bad! The hotel staff were really friendly, although not all of them spoke English (but I don't speak Dutch so I can't complain too much!). They bent over backwards to help us! The bus service was so punctual (admitadly they weren't frequent) that it made getting around so easy (definately reccommend buying a pass as it covers the train, tram, bus and boat!) and the night bus was totally ace as well! Felt so safe travelling home in the middle of the night. My best bit of advice is to buy a guide book before you go as finding somewhere nice to eat in the city centre is hard for picky eaters! Red light district is a must - very peculiar but really fun night out! Bars just outside of there on the canal are lovely as well. All in all had a really fantastic few days in Amsterdam and would definately recommend our hotel even though it was a bit of a trek from the city centre - the facilities were great and the bathroom was quirky. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - a little far from town”
Reviews.Author: Nigelhu
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the hotel. I chose it because it had secure underground parking (â‚¬17.50/night), and was easily accessible from the ringroad system. The hotel was clean and modern and the rooms large and comfortable. The staff spoke good English and were friendly. Breakfast was extra, so we chose to eat in town instead. The hotel is a good 30 minutes walk to the centre of town. There is a railway station next to it, however the two bus routes which pass the hotel seemed to be the most frequent way to the city centre. A taxi from central station will cost you a little over â‚¬15. As the previous reviewer noted, take anything out the fridge and the sensor automatically charges it to your bill. A little sneaky perhaps? And if you pay by credit card there is not a problem with a deposit. Overall, a great modern hotel, but perhaps a little too far from the centre of to be convenient for a stay of over 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but staff hostile”
Reviews.Author: Mazza14
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay at the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art. This is our second visit to Amsterdam and as we enjoyed ourselves last year we thought we would go back and stay at this hotel again. On checking in we discovered that the hotel has a new ''policy'' where they impose a cover charge of euro 50 per day to cover any expenses you may incur. In our case as we were staying 4 days this meant an additional euro 200 plus the cost of our room. Reception staff were most insistent that we paid this immediately on checking in. This ''policy'' is not on the hotel's website and we think it should be so that future guests if paying in cash (as we were) can budget for this. We did not pay this ''policy'' charge last year. Beware of the sensors in the fridge - take any item out (even if you dont drink or eat it) put it back in the same spot in the fridge - and hey presto it is on your bill when you checkout. Be warned. Also we found the staff on reception not to be guest friendly at all. Room service was poor. We rang one evening at 10.40 to order a sandwich - room service said ''sorry the kitchen closes at 10.30''. We appreciate that all hotels must have a deadline when they close but we were not asking for a 4 course meal - just a cheese sandwich!! A little flexibility would be welcome. The Art Cafe stays open until 1.00 am for drinks but (you've guessed it) food orders close at 10.30 so no joy there! More hassle when we went to pay our hotel bill at reception at around 9.30 pm the night before our departure. After we had paid in full the receptionist asked for a further euro 50 as a deposit - we couldn't believe it. We were in fact going to bed as we had an early morning flight the next morning and were leaving at 6.00 am. The hotel seems to view all its guests as potential criminals!! The buses were unreliable and we often had a 20-30 minute wait for them (of course the other alternative was to walk)! On a more positive note, our room was in good order; spacious, clean and comfortable. Sorry that this review is all moans - but it was one 'bug'' after another. We would not stay at this hotel again as there is plenty of choice out there!! Anyway we hope your enjoy your stay!! Asta la Vista.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: RichardOrmson
Reviews.Content: As noted in other reviews this hotel is a little out of the way, but you get much larger rooms and a quiet location as a trade off. The bus routes seem to have changed recently. When I went in May 05, bus number 48 (running between central station and sloterdijk station and back)stops outside the door, while bus 22 (to/from central station) terminates about 250 metres away. There is also a night bus service to/from the stops outside the hotel door. So getting to and from the city centre is not a problem. It's about 10 minutes on the bus or a half hour walk. One of the airport hopper busses also runs to the hotel, although I didn't use this so can't comment on the service. The hotel itself is modern and well maintained, with helpful (english speaking) staff. The artwork is interesting, but not really to my taste. Hotel restaurant is good for evening meals, although not cheap. Bar has a small range of local beers and a selection of foreign beers and liquors. Breakfast is a good quality buffet. Do not try to go for breakfast at the last minute though - everyone else has the same idea! The rooms are spacious and clean. If you book a triple (family room) then you actually get a larger room - unlike most hotels in Amsterdam where you just get an extra bed in a standard room. Overall I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who isn't too bothered about staying in the heart of the action. If you're after the red light district then this probably isn't for you!

Reviews.Title: “Saving Grace”
Reviews.Author: JohnFreedem
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. We got there early on Sunday (Easter) morning and we found that the Amstel Botel lost our reservation so we found the number to this hotel at the airport. This hotel was actually our first choice but while we were looking for less expensive alternatives we changed our minds. It was definitely worth the extra money. The only downside is that the hotel is not in the center and you have to travel a little bit to get to the action. Luckily, the 22, 48 and night bus stop right in front of the hotel (they have bus schedules at the hotel) and they run all night long. The ride is only 10-15 minutes to dam center. You don't need a car while you are their. They have an excellent public transit system. They hotel is great though!!!

Reviews.Title: “We got in great shape by making the walk to the tulip!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a wonderful property! my 18 nights in the middle of winter will go down as my best vacation ever! yes it is a bit out of the center of things, but unless it was raining I personally opted to walk into the center every time I went (and I managed to loose about 10 pounds this trip by walking everywhere, yay!) my wife called the walk our "Amsterdam, buns of steel workout", we both had a great time, and enjoyed the surrounding neighborhood. the staff was professional and courtious at all times and some of the clerks even knew our names by the time we left. The art is fresh and bold, and the building was warm and in a safe neighborhood, where we were remembered at every business we visited more then once, the people in the area don't get the hords of tourists that you get in the city center so they tend to open up a bit and talk to you, also not a pickpocket to be found in this area either! from the centeral station to the hotel door is about a 25 minute walk at a brisk pace. yes, it is a bit out, yes it is a long walk, yes, we were in great shape when we got home, and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Top marks!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after booking via the internet at a very good price. Good points about this hotel: - Clean rooms - ours was cleaned and linen and towels were replaced twice in 2 days! -Very friendly staff - Modern decor -Comfortable bed and sofa -Toiletteries provided -Bus stop outside hotel door into Amsterdam central (Centraal station) -Price -BBC1 and 2 on tv in room Bad points about this hotel: -Automatic doors have to be opened if you want to exit or enter the hotel and if none of the staff are around, you have to wait for someone to appear -Situation of hotel is near an industrial estate TNT over the road - our view was of a disused railtrack! All in all, stop here if you are not bothered about the view from the hotel as we came to Amsterdam to see the city and as the room was modern and clean this hotel was more than sufficient for us. A bus stops outside the hotel and costs approx 2,50 euros each (one way) into the centre. I recommend you buy a strippenkarten (available at most newsagents (normally says on the door if they sell them)) of 15 or 45 lines dependant on how far you travel more lines will be used. 2 lines are used (stamped by driver) per person one way from hotel to Centraal station.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in November 2004 (Friday and Saturday nights). Booked via Expedia. Found the hotel and room to be clean and contemporarily decorated - Good value compared to the more expensive Park Hotel in Den Haag we stayed prior to moving to this hotel. However this hotel is about 15 minutes bus ride from the Amsterdam central station - ask the bus driver to give you a shout at the correct stop as the bus stop is on the opposite side of the hotel (when arriving from the central station). If you are a tea or coffee lover, note that there are NO COMPLIMENTARY tea/coffee nor kettle or cups provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great design, but a bit out of the center”
Reviews.Author: denealio
Reviews.Content: I agree with most comments, great design, good value and so much better than all the sub-par hotels in Amsterdam. However, the hotel is a bit of a hike to the center of town. Buses 48 & 49 stop directly in front, and number 22 is close. I just wish the hotel's website had a better map and information on how to get there. (They do give you a very good printed map upon check-in.) On the trip back, I used the Connexxion Bus to Schipol, it stops at the hotel is was 11 EUR. There is high speed internet in the rooms and the lobby has T-Mobile HotSpot Wi-Fi. Room safe was big enough to hold a laptop. It is actually 2 hotels in one. The Tulip Amsterdam Art and the GOLDEN Tulip Amsterdam Art. One side is a *** hotel, and the Golden is the **** part. Same check-in desk, lobby, restaurants, etc. If you can spend the extra 10-20 EURO and get a room in Golden part, they have very nice bathtubs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Amsterdam Art Hotel was a clean, comfortable good value hotel, close to the centre of Amsterdam on the bus (there are 2 different services going from outside the hotel to the Central Station). There is also a huge outdoor swimming pool next door which hotel guests can use for a nominal charge. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Art in the city(ok it's just outside)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time at this hotel. The decor was interesting and surprisingly comfortable, people were friendly, there's even an outdoor swimming pool! But I have to warn you about the minibars in the rooms as you get charged for LIFTING things off the shelves. I would also recommend taking a city guide to Amsterdam as the transport system is quite confusing. On arrival, it might be easier to go to central station first then back on yourselves, get buses 48 or 49 which stop right opposite the hotel or 22 which goes round the corner after the BP station. To be honest we didn't spend that much time at the hotel as there was so much to do in town. All in all it was a very enjoyable trip and we shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great value, well decorated room, very nice bar, respectful and pleasant staff. I bought a 72 hour pass for busses and trams at the airport which turned out to be a good move. This hotel is in a quiet neighborhood near a park which gave me the feeling of living in Amsterdam rather than being a tourist. The Tulip Art has one of the few hotel bars I actually enjoyed. Meet a few nice girls from Spain and Sweden there. I was very comfortable at this hotel and knowing that for what I paid to stay at the Tulip Art I've could have stayed in a tiny depressing room downtown for the same rate makes me feel like I've won the lotto.
